poem:
Escalation

In the quiet night,  
drones hum like wasps  
bearing steel stingers. 

Fields of sunflowers  
now homes for memory—  
six voices cease,  

and whispers travel  
on the winds of careless ambition.  
Crazy,  
like broken clocks,  
morning waits  
for direction.
